Class LightBulb

java.lang.Object
  LightBulb

public class LightBulb
extends java.lang.Object

class LightBulb , consists of a color and state which defines if the bulb is switched on or off.

Constructor Summary
LightBulb(int red, int green, int blue)
          Construct a new LightBulb with the given color component values.
LightBulb(LightBulb other)
          Construct a new LightBulb which is a copy of the given bulb.
LightBulb(RGBColor color)
          Construct a new LightBulb with a given color.
 
Method Summary
 RGBColor getColor()
          Returns the color component of this bulb.
 boolean isSwitchedOn()
          Returns true if this bulb is switched on.
 void setColor(RGBColor color)
          Sets the color component of this LightBulb.
 void switchLight()
          Changes the switch situation from true to false and vice versa.
 java.lang.String toString()
          Returns a string representation of this LightBulb.

Constructor Detail

LightBulb

public LightBulb(int red,
                 int green,
                 int blue)
Construct a new LightBulb with the given color component values. The switch is initialized to false. If one (or more) of the given values is illegal (not in the range 0-255), it constructs a black RGBColor object.

Parameters:
red - The red color component value.
green - The green color component value.
blue - The blue color component value.

LightBulb

public LightBulb(LightBulb other)
Construct a new LightBulb which is a copy of the given bulb. Assumes the given bulb is not null.

Parameters:
other - The LightBulb to copy.

LightBulb

public LightBulb(RGBColor color)
Construct a new LightBulb with a given color. The switch is initialized to false. Assumes the given color is not null.

Parameters:
other - The RGBColor to copy.
Method Detail

getColor

public RGBColor getColor()
Returns the color component of this bulb.

Returns:
The color component of this bulb.

isSwitchedOn

public boolean isSwitchedOn()
Returns true if this bulb is switched on. Otherwise, returns false.

Returns:
true if the bulb is switched on.

setColor

public void setColor(RGBColor color)
Sets the color component of this LightBulb.

Parameters:
color - The color component to set.

switchLight

public void switchLight()
Changes the switch situation from true to false and vice versa.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this LightBulb. For example (255,127,0) On
